avivAngular.content.context: Group specialized in the publication of real estate advertisement websites
avivAngular.content.project: Management of the site dedicated to real estate professionals (back office) and the site for posting rental, life annuity and sales advertisements for professionals and individuals, within a multidisciplinary team of varying sizes over time (therefore an ability to work both in a fairly large team and as the sole front-end developer in the team)
avivAngular.content.tasks.1: Development, maintenance, optimization and testing of applications
avivAngular.content.tasks.2: Contribution, implementation of new functionalities (by creating high-level and low-level components; by writing and consuming utility services or communication with the backend, etc.) in a library architecture, in particular a UI library (design-system)
avivAngular.content.tasks.3: Technical development of application testing strategy architecture (unit, integration, e2e tests)
avivAngular.content.tasks.5: Guild operations and participation in architectural decisions
avivAngular.title: Angular Frontend Developer (v6 - v17)
avivReact.content.context: Group specialized in the publication of real estate advertisement websites
avivReact.content.project: Management of the site dedicated to the acquisition of advertising spaces on the official sites of the AVIV group and distribution of advertising campaigns to Meta's social media (Facebook and Instagram)
avivReact.content.tasks.1: Creation and testing of components, hooks, etc.
avivReact.content.tasks.2: State management using contexts or consuming and hydrating stores (Redux)
avivReact.content.tasks.3: Use of a design system developed by a dedicated team
avivReact.content.tasks.4: Implementing iframe features for communicating a React app within an Angular app
avivReact.content.tasks.5: Guild operation, contribution to the implementation of cross-cutting subjects
avivReact.title: Frontend React Developer (v18)
cvApp.content.context: Personal project to showcase my technical expertise in web development
cvApp.content.project: Application serving as a resume to introduce myself and showcase my technical expertise in web programming. While waiting for the next opportunity, I started to develop this application with the aim of putting it online.
cvApp.content.tasks.1: Development, optimization of Frontend features and prolific use of the TailwindCSS library
cvApp.content.tasks.2: Implementation of the functionality to switch between light and dark modes
cvApp.content.tasks.3: Implementation of the language switching functionality (French, English, and Dutch)
cvApp.content.tasks.4: Development and optimization of the backend layer in NodeJS and ExpressJS
cvApp.content.tasks.5: Writing unit and visual integration tests on the Angular side
cvApp.title: Fullstack Angular (v19) / NodeJS developer
education.institution: The Hague University of Applied Sciences
education.title: Electrical engineering
intro.firstParagraph:
I'm an experienced Frontend developer with 7 years' experience working with Angular (from v2-beta to v17).
 With a solid grounding in TypeScript, I've easily mastered the Swiss army knife that is Angular, and have a wealth of knowledge and best practices in its daily use; including a thorough understanding of component-based architecture, dependency injection and the use of decorators.
intro.quote: “Everything you have learned so far only makes sense if it has an application.”
intro.secondParagraph: When I started diving professionally into the React ecosystem a year ago, I wanted to explore its unique features and philosophies, such as the virtual DOM, TSX, the concepts of hooks, contexts, and other nuggets of this library.
intro.subtitle: Confirmed Angular Frontend Developer - 7 years of experience
intro.thirdParagraph: But since we have to make a choice! Today with the emergence of AI all around us, and in particular Github Copilot which wonderfully assists developers, Angular becomes even more attractive to me because of its completeness and the reduction of its 'complexity'. Since I now have the luxury of having my code co-piloted, it's better to do it on board of a big Airbus A380 for the challenge, that is to say the complete machine that Angular represents.
qDelft.content.project: Teacher career management solution (300,000 teachers) for CIBG (part of the Dutch Ministry of Education, Sport and Welfare) within a team of 15 people including 8 developers
qDelft.content.tasks.1: Creation of reusable components within a UI library
qDelft.content.tasks.2: Implementation of multiple features (including asynchronous search within the application, activity sharing between users, registration functionality, etc.)
qDelft.title: Angular  (v2 - v5)/.Net Developer
rights-reserved: All rights reserved. I agree that my personal data will be processed as part of the recruitment process for the job I am applying for.
